newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan money rates end up amid market operation.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan money rates end up amid market operation.

text.p: Pakistani money rates closed higher levels on Wednesday amid an open market operation (OMO) by the State (centra) Bank of Pakistan, dealers said.
They said overnight rates were likely to remain high despite inflows from a maturing OMO. "The overnight market traded at the same 20 percent level," a Standard Chartered Bank dealer said.

He said banks discounted an estimated 10 billion rupees from the central bank to square their positions. An inflow of five billion rupees was expected on Thursday on maturity of paper sold in an OMO, but rates might not move much as the market was at least 10 billion rupees short. -- Ovais Subhani 9221-5685192
